meanings.definition: An official list or record, especially one for keeping track of information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher checked the attendance registers to see who was absent.
meanings.sent2: The hospital keeps detailed registers of all patient admissions.
meanings.sent3: The registers of the school library were so old, they looked like ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like registers, capturing every detail of the scene before her.
meanings.sent5: The registers of the town hall were filled with historical records dating back centuries.

meanings.definition: To enter or record information in an official list or record.
meanings.sent1: Please make sure to registers your name at the front desk.
meanings.sent2: The secretary registers all incoming mail in the logbook.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to registers its paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to registers in her mind long after he had spoken.
meanings.sent5: The cashier quickly registers the total amount of the purchase on the cash register.

meanings.definition: To adjust or regulate the operation of a device or system.
meanings.sent1: He carefully registers the thermostat to keep the room warm.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic needs to registers the engine to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to registers its movements to avoid bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice seemed to registers the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The conductor registers the speed of the train to ensure a safe journey.

meanings.definition: To show a particular quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent2: The artist's style registers a sense of freedom and creativity.
meanings.sent3: The cake registers a perfect balance of sweetness and flavor.
meanings.sent4: The music registers a sense of nostalgia and longing.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes registers a deep sense of sorrow and regret.
